# FlattenCollection | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Swift ](/documentation/swift)

-  FlattenCollection 

Type Alias# FlattenCollection

iOS 8.0+iPadOS 8.0+Mac Catalyst 13.0+macOS 10.10+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
typealias FlattenCollection<T> = FlattenSequence<T> where T : Collection, T.Element : Collection
```

## [See Also](/documentation/Swift/FlattenCollection#see-also)

### [Wrappers for Algorithms](/documentation/Swift/FlattenCollection#Wrappers-for-Algorithms)

[`struct CollectionDifference`](/documentation/swift/collectiondifference)A collection of insertions and removals that describe the difference between two ordered collection states.[`struct DropFirstSequence`](/documentation/swift/dropfirstsequence)A sequence that lazily consumes and drops `n` elements from an underlying `Base` iterator before possibly returning the first available element.[`struct DropWhileSequence`](/documentation/swift/dropwhilesequence)A sequence that lazily consumes and drops `n` elements from an underlying `Base` iterator before possibly returning the first available element.[`struct EnumeratedSequence`](/documentation/swift/enumeratedsequence)An enumeration of the elements of a sequence or collection.[`struct FlattenSequence`](/documentation/swift/flattensequence)A sequence consisting of all the elements contained in each segment contained in some `Base` sequence.[`struct JoinedSequence`](/documentation/swift/joinedsequence)A sequence that presents the elements of a base sequence of sequences concatenated using a given separator.[`struct PrefixSequence`](/documentation/swift/prefixsequence)A sequence that only consumes up to `n` elements from an underlying `Base` iterator.[`struct Repeated`](/documentation/swift/repeated)A collection whose elements are all identical.[`struct ReversedCollection`](/documentation/swift/reversedcollection)A collection that presents the elements of its base collection in reverse order.[`struct StrideTo`](/documentation/swift/strideto)A sequence of values formed by striding over a half-open interval.[`struct StrideThrough`](/documentation/swift/stridethrough)A sequence of values formed by striding over a closed interval.[`struct UnfoldSequence`](/documentation/swift/unfoldsequence)A sequence whose elements are produced via repeated applications of a closure to some mutable state.[`struct Zip2Sequence`](/documentation/swift/zip2sequence)A sequence of pairs built out of two underlying sequences.
